# packages/adapter-rust/vendor/codelldb/darwin-x64/lldb/lib/python3.12/site-packages/pip/_vendor/rich/terminal_theme.py
@source-hash: d63e7eb9f25f9ef9
@generated: 2026-02-09T18:00:05Z

## Terminal Theme Definition Module

**Primary Purpose:** Defines color themes for terminal/console content export in the Rich library. Provides structured color palettes with predefined themes for different visual styles.

### Key Components

**TerminalTheme Class (L9-30):**
- Main data structure representing a complete terminal color theme
- Constructor takes background, foreground, normal (8 colors), and optional bright colors (8 colors)
- Converts RGB tuples to ColorTriplet objects for background/foreground (L27-28)
- Creates unified ANSI color palette by concatenating normal + bright colors (L29)
- Falls back to normal colors if bright colors not provided

### Dependencies
- `ColorTriplet` from `.color_triplet` - RGB color representation
- `Palette` from `.palette` - ANSI color palette management
- Type annotations for RGB tuples and optional lists

### Predefined Themes

**DEFAULT_TERMINAL_THEME (L32-55):**
- Standard terminal colors with white background, black text
- Classic 16-color ANSI palette (8 normal + 8 bright variants)

**MONOKAI (L57-80):**
- Dark theme inspired by Monokai color scheme
- Dark background (12,12,12), light foreground (217,217,217)
- Only 7 bright colors defined (missing 8th)

**DIMMED_MONOKAI (L81-104):**
- Muted variant of Monokai with softer contrast
- Slightly lighter background (25,25,25)
- 9 normal colors, 7 bright colors

**NIGHT_OWLISH (L105-128):**
- Light background theme with dark text
- 9 normal colors, 7 bright colors
- Inspired by Night Owl editor theme

**SVG_EXPORT_THEME (L130-153):**
- Specialized theme for SVG export functionality
- Dark background optimized for vector graphics
- 9 normal colors, 7 bright colors

### Architectural Notes
- All themes use RGB tuples (0-255 values per channel)
- Inconsistent color array lengths across themes (some have 7-9 instead of standard 8)
- Theme objects are module-level constants for easy import/reuse
- Design supports both 8-color and 16-color terminal standards
